column2: ALASKA DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Alaska
column6: AK

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When passing you should NOT:
column4: leave less than 4 feet of space between your vehicle and the vehicle you are passing.
column6: signal left to let others know that you will be pulling out.
column8: look in your rearview mirrors and glance over your shoulder before pulling out to pass.
column10: go far enough past the vehicle you are passing so that you can see the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror.

column2: 2. It is illegal to drive below the speed limit:
column4: when the pavement is wet.
column6: only in residential areas.
column8: when driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 3. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: one hour.
column6: 3 hours.
column8: 10 minutes.

column2: 4. To drive more safely at night:
column4: don’t drive when you are tired.
column6: make sure your headlights are working properly.
column8: increase following distance.

column2: 5. When you reach an intersection with a traffic light showing a left green arrow, you should:
column4: stop, then make the left turn.
column6: wait until the light turns green.
column8: increase your speed and turn left before the arrow turns red.
column10: turn left when intersection is clear.

column2: 6. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 7. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column6: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you are not allowed to park here.

column2: 8. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.

column2: 9. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a steering failure.
column6: of a brake failure.
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 10. You arrive at the same time as another vehicle at an intersection has no traffic signs or signals. You should:
column4: slow down and yield to the vehicle on the right.
column6: speed up and get through the intersection.
column8: sound your horn and drive through the intersection with extreme caution.
column10: drive through the intersection and make the other vehicle stop.

column2: 11. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: green; white
column6: white; black
column8: blue; white

column2: 12. The penalty for driving without motor vehicle liability insurance is license suspension for a minimum of:
column4: 90 days.
column6: 1 year.
column8: 30 days.

column2: 13. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 14. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed and move to the left.
column6: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column6: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column8: Vehicles may only turn left.

column2: 16. The road surface becomes very slippery when rain first starts to fall because:
column4: rain mixes with oils, dust and road film that cover the road's surface.
column6: your tires absorb more water at first.
column8: water tends to pool more at that time.
column10: it rains harder during that time.

column2: 17. Which one of the following is not a night driving safety tip?
column4: Keep the windshield clean.
column6: Wear sunglasses in bright sunlight.
column8: Look into the headlights of approaching cars.

column2: 18. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must change lane immediately.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 19. Worn tires:
column4: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.
column6: can increase your stopping distance.
column8: can make turning more difficult.

column2: 20. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
